headline.main: In TV Habits, Like Mother, Like Child

docs.abstract: Study finds that preschool children whose mothers are obese or depressed tend to watch more television than other children (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Preschool children whose mothers are obese or depressed tend to watch more television than other children, a study has found. The researchers, who presented their findings last week in Quebec at a conference of the North American Association for the Study of Obesity, said that in families they had studied, the children of obese mothers watched television on average half an hour more a day than the children over all, who watched for two hours a day. If the mothers were also depressed, the children watched about an hour more.
